The age of the player at the end of this season/selected period. For winter leagues the season end is taken as May 31st, for summer leagues it is taken as December 31st
The number of matches the player has participated in on-pitch this season (starts and substitute appearances).
The number of minutes played this season. This value is used to calculate all other stat values as per-90.
The number of starts the player has made this season
Number of assists.
Passes that create shots for teammates. Can also be seen to be referred to as "shot assists" or "chances created"
Number of assists from open play.
Passes that create shots for teammates, just from open play
xG assisted from open play.
Number of assists from set pieces
Passes that create shots for teammates, just from set pieces
xG assisted from set pieces
xG assisted. This is calculated from the expected goal value of the assisted shot
Number of times a player loses the ball by getting tackled.
Percentage of dribbles that were successful
An attempt by the player to beat the opponent with the ball at their feet
Number of dribbles attempted that were unsuccessful.
How many times a player is fouled.
Number of penalties won.
How often a player successfully dribbles past an opponent
How often a player loses the ball via a miscontrol or a failed dribble.
Goals and assists above expectation. The difference between scoring contribution (actual contribution to goals) and xG & xG Assisted (expected contribution to goals)
Rating value.
Non-penalty goals and assists. A combined measure of the direct goal contribution of a player via goalscoring or goal assisting
Non-penalty shots and key passes. A combined measure of a player's contribution to shots via shots themselves or the key pass prior to the shot
Non-penalty xG and xG Assisted. A combined measure of a player's contribution to shots via shots themselves or the key pass prior to the shot, measured in terms of expected goal values
Percentage of non-penalty shots a player takes that are converted into goals.
All goals scored by the player, including penalties.
Goals scored (not including penalties).
Percentage of penalty shots a player takes that are converted into goals.
Post Shot xG earned from on-target shots.
The percentage of total shots by a player that are on target (includes goals, saved, and cleared off line).
Number of non-penalty shots a player takes.
The amount of shots a player takes as a proportion of their touches of the ball.
Non-penalty expected goals produced by the player.
A measure of shot quality, this looks at the average non-penalty expected goal value per shot a player takes.
How many red cards the player obtains
How many times a player obtains a second yellow card
How many yellow cards the player obtains
Tackles, pressure events and fouls recorded within 2 seconds of an opposition ball receipt
The average distance from the goal line that the player successfully makes a defensive action. The scale is the x-axis of the pitch, measured from 0-100.
Number of ball recoveries.
Blocks made per shot faced.
Number of clearances made by a player.
Times a player’s team won the ball back within 5 seconds of the player making a defensive action against an opponent.
Tackles, pressure events and fouls recorded.
Number of interceptions.
How many ball recoveries the player made in the opposition (final) half of the pitch
Number of clearances adjusted proportionally to the possession volume of a team
Number of interceptions adjusted proportionally to the possession volume of a team
Percentage of aerial duels a player enters that they win
Number of aerial duels a player wins.
How often a player fails a challenge and is dribbled past.
Of the dribbles faced by this player, what % of them were unsuccessful (stopped).
How many errors the player makes per 90. An error is an on the ball mistake that led to a shot.
How many fouls a player commits
Number of tackles adjusted proportionally to the possession volume of a team
Number of tackles and interceptions adjusted proportionally to the possession volume of a team
Percentage of time a player makes a tackle when going into a duel vs getting dribbled past.
Successful challenges made.
Combination of tackles and interceptions
The average distance from the goal line that the player presses opponents with the ball. The scale here is the x-axis of the pitch, measured from 0-100.
Times a player’s team won the ball back within 5 seconds of the player counterpressuring an opponent.
Number of counterpressures. Counterpressures are pressures exerted within 5 seconds of a turnover.
How many counterpressures the player is exerting in the opposition (final) half of the pitch.
How many counterpressures the player is exerting in the opposition (final) half of the pitch, as a percentage of their total counterpressures.
Possession adjusted pressures.
Times a player’s team won the ball back within 5 seconds of the player pressuring an opponent.
The number of times a player pressures an opposition player.
How many pressures the player is exerting in the opposition (final) half of the pitch.
How many pressures the player is exerting in the opposition (final) half of the pitch, as a percentage of their total pressures.
Claims or CCAA% (Claimable Collection Attempts over Average), is a measure of how likely the goalkeeper is to attempt to claim a "claimable" pass, versus the average goalkeeper attempted claim rate.
An average value of how far from the goal the goalkeeper is coming forward to perform defensive actions.
Percentage of passes made where the recipient was deemed to be under pressure or was next engaged with a defensive action
Percentage of passes made where the recipient was under pressure
A possession that connected through the player and resulted in either a shot, free kick in the attacking half or a corner
How frequently is the player involved in sequences that resolve with a positive outcome while on the pitch
Count of all shots faced by the goalkeeper (including off-target shots.)
Given the post-shot xG (modelled from on frame location) of shots faced by the goalkeeper what % would we expect them to save?
Count of goals conceded by the goalkeeper (not including penalties or own goals).
How many goals did the keeper save/concede versus expectation (post-shot xG faced)? This is representative of how many goals the goalkeeper's saves prevented wthin a season.
Number of penalties faced that resulted in goals.
Number of penalties faced.

How far from the optimal position for facing a shot the Goalkeeper is (on average). This metric is modelled from a starting point of the average location of goalkeepers from 20 shots from similar locations and the deviation from that average is the distance away from the "optimal" location for any given goalkeeper location on a shot.
Total post-shot xG of on-target shots faced by the goalkeeper, as predicted from a trained and calibrated model of only shots on target. Penalties not included.
Percentage of on-target shots that were saved by the goalkeeper.
Count of on-target shots faced by the goalkeeper.
Percentage of shots faced by the goalkeeper that were on-target.
The measure of goals saved above average, as a percentage of shots faced by the goalkeeper.
Total xG from all non-penalty shots faced (including off target shots)
On Ball Value Added (net) from Defensive Actions
On Ball Value Added (net) from Dribbles and Carries
On Ball Value Added (net) Goalkeeper
On Ball Value Added (net) total (all event types).
On Ball Value Added (net) from Passes
On Ball Value Added (net) from Shots
Percentage of attempted crosses that are successful and received by a teammate
Successful passes within 20 metres of the opposition goal.
Successful open play final third passes.
Successful passes into the box from outside the box (open play).
Passes completed inside the box.
Successful passes into box from outside the box
Successful passes into the box from outside the box (open play) and touches inside the box combined
A pass into the box from a set piece situation (indirect free kick, corner, throw in)
What percentage of a player's completed passes into the box are crosses. See Event Specification for details of cross location definition.
Completed crosses.
A completed pass splitting the defence for a teammate to run onto.
Successful footed touches inside the box (including shots)
A player controls the ball at their feet while moving or standing still.
Percentage of a player's carries that were successful.
Average carry length.
Passes and dribbles/carries into the opposition final third.

A model that attributes the xG value of the final shot to all players involved in the entire possession. The buildup version omits xG and xG Assisted to focus on possession work prior to the end of the chain
A model that attributes the xG value of the final shot to all players involved in the entire possession.

Proportion of a player's passes in the final third that are angled backwards. Backwards is defined as the arc of the circle from 5π/6 to 7π/6, of the circle 0:2π; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)

Proportion of a player's passes in the final third that are angled forwards. Forwards is defined as the arc of the circle from 11π/6 to π/6, of the circle 0:2π; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)

Proportion of a player's passes in the final third that are angled sideways. Sideways is defined as the arc of the circle from π/6 to 5π/6, and from 7π/6 to 11π/6, of the circle 0:2π,; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)

Proportion of a player's passes that are angled backwards. Backwards is defined as the arc of the circle from 5π/6 to 7π/6, of the circle 0:2π; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)

Proportion of a player's passes that are angled forwards. Forwards is defined as the arc of the circle from 11π/6 to π/6, of the circle 0:2π; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)

Proportion of a player's passes that are angled sideways. Sideways is defined as the arc of the circle from π/6 to 5π/6, and from 7π/6 to 11π/6, of the circle 0:2π,; angle-0 means a 0 change in y-coordinate (i.e. towards the opponent's goal line)
The average distance from the goal line that the player successfully makes a pass. The scale is the x-axis of the pitch, measured from 0-100.
How does passing % change when under pressure? This is calculated as Pressured Pass % minus Pass %.
Proportion of footed passes made by this player with their left foot. Players can be considered left-footed when this value is over 60% (and right-footed at less than 40%).
Percentage of attempted long balls that are actually completed.
Number of completed long balls
Number of attempted passes in open play.
Proportion of passes that were made while under opponent pressure
Percentage of all passes attempted that were completed.
Number of clearances or long balls attempted while under pressure.
Proportion of pressured passes that were completed
Times a player plays a long ball while not under pressure

Metric Name: Being Pressured Change in Pass Length
Definition: Difference in the pass length when under pressure. This is calculated as the pressured pass length minus pass length.
Average pass length.
Ratio between the completed pass length and pass length.
Average pass length of passes made under pressure.
Ratio between the completed pass length and pass length of passes made under pressure
Average pass length of completed passes.
Pass length of successful passes made under pressure.
How many red cards the team obtains
How many times a team obtains a second yellow card
How many yellow cards the team obtains
The proportion of an opponent's pass receipts that are tackled, fouled or pressured within 2 seconds.
Tackles, pressure events and fouls a team makes within 2 seconds of an opposition ball receipt.
Times a team won the ball back within 5 seconds of a defensive action by one of their players.
The average distance from a teams own goal from which it makes defensive actions.

How many passes does a team allow the opponent before making a defensive action (tackle, interception, foul). An indicator of pressing intensity this metric is defined in attacking areas ie 40% of the length of the pitch away from a team's own goal and forwards.
Average actual clock time the ball spends in play
Standard metric for how much possession a team averages per match.
Number of possessions.
Times a team won the ball back within 5 seconds of a player counterpressuring an opponent.
Pressures exerted within 5 seconds of a turnover.
How many counterpressures are exerted in the opposition (final) half of the pitch.
How many counterpressures are exerted in the opposition (final) half of the pitch, as a percentage of their total counterpressures.
Ball is regained within 5 seconds of a player pressuring an opponent.
The number of times a team pressures the opponent
How many pressures are exerted in the opposition (final) half of the pitch.
How many pressures are exerted in the opposition (final) half of the pitch, as a percentage of their total pressures.
Goals scored minus goals conceded

Goals conceded (including penalties) plus own goals.
